Make1: On 12/15/2025 at approximately 1430 hours, officers responded to 123 Main Street for a report of a stolen bicycle. Upon arrival, the victim stated that a black Schwinn mountain bike valued at $400 was taken from the front porch between 1200 and 1430 hours. The suspect was described as a male, white, approximately 25-30 years old, 5'10", wearing a red hoodie and blue jeans. The suspect fled on foot heading north on Main Street. No surveillance footage available. Case assigned to Detective Bureau for follow-up.

On 12/16/2025 at 0815 hours, officers responded to 456 River Road for a stolen vehicle. The victim reported that a 2018 Honda Civic, silver in color, NJ plate ABC123, was taken overnight between 2200 hours on 12/15/2025 and 0800 hours on 12/16/2025. Vehicle was parked in the driveway. No signs of forced entry. Vehicle valued at $15,000. NCIC entry made. Witness reported seeing a suspicious male wearing dark clothing near the vehicle at approximately 2300 hours on 12/15/2025.

On 12/17/2025 at 2200 hours, officers responded to 789 Oak Avenue for a burglary in progress. Upon arrival, officers observed a broken rear window. Homeowner stated that suspect(s) entered through the rear window and fled when alarm sounded. Items taken include a 55-inch Samsung TV ($800), laptop computer ($1200), and jewelry ($2000). Total value stolen: $4000. Point of entry: rear window, pried open with unknown tool. Latent prints lifted from window frame. Two suspects observed fleeing on foot: Suspect 1 - male, hispanic, 20s, black jacket; Suspect 2 - male, black, 20s, gray hoodie. Both fled eastbound through backyard.
